description: After a long evening reviewing both vaults, Lenart Kova decides to release Halden's confessional letters. He authenticates and uploads them to an automated protocol, permanently erasing the survivor testimonies.

Citizens and Council members awaken to a citywide flood of 'Halden confessions,' personal messages revealing his doubts and fears about the BCI and his motives for controversial decisions. Debate breaks out on every street and network.
Copies of the "Halden letters" appear pinned in public squares and transit stations, with communities gathering to discuss compliance, control, and the possibility of true self-governance.
Public forums erupt across Stenograd, as civic leaders and everyday residents openly debate whether any form of the BCI should return or if the city should attempt decentralized governance.

A final confession from Halden emerges, revealing he designed the BCI with a deliberate dilemma—forcing society to ultimately choose between submission and freedom. The Council announces a citywide referendum to determine the system's fate.
